document_data.mainbody:
ine sausages were a delicious and strongly mint-flavored sausage dish available in the town of Mosstone in Tethyr.
Wine sausages were served at the Oak-Fathers Boon inn in Mosstone. In the late 14 century DR, Volothamp Geddarm mentioned the dish along with bowl of hares as some of the best offerings from the Boon.
